div.h3: EMERGENCY MESSAGE: 4/17/2020 at 2:35 PM -- Refresh page to update message
div.p: Governor Larry Hogan and State Superintendent of Schools Karen Salmon announced on April 17 that Maryland public schools will be closed until May 15 in an effort to combat the spread of COVID-19.
div.h3: MENSAJES DE EMERGENCIA: 4/17/2020, 2:35 PM -- Refresque la página para actualizar mensaje
div.p: Oficiales del estado anunciaron hoy que todas las escuelas del estado de Maryland estarán cerradas hasta el 15 de mayo.

section.h2: What is new in our Community

h2.a: MCPS Coronavirus Updates and Online Learning Information

article.p: The most recent information from MCPS about online learning, meal service for students, engagement activities for children and much more can be found here. See the list of links below and the other stories on this page. Due to Governor Larry Hogan's order school buildings are closed until April 24.

a.title: NEW: April 19, Community Message-Updates About the School Calendar and Online Learning

li.a: NEW: April 19, Community Message-Updates About the School Calendar and Online Learning

a.title: MCPS Coronavirus Information Webpage and FAQs

li.a: MCPS Coronavirus Information Webpage and FAQs

h2.a: Student Member of the Board- Election Now May 20

article.p: The two candidates for the 43rd SMOB are Mr. Nick Asante, a junior at Richard Montgomery High School and Ms. Vicky Kidder, a junior at Magruder High School. All secondary students will receive an email on May 20 with a link to the ballot.

li.a: VIDEO: The candidates share their thoughts about the COVID-19 pandemic

article.p: The Office of Student and Family Support and Engagement has begun a new video series covering social emotional supports and student well-being entitled MCPS Waymaking. This pilot issue tackles identification of stress that students may exhibit and is aimed at providing support to our parent community and community at large.
Learn how to subscribe to Alert MCPS and receive text messages or email from MCPS during emergencies, as well as systemwide messages of significant importance. alert.montgomerycountymd.gov

a.title: Directions and maps to schools and facilities

div.p: Find school to attend using your home address
Information about enrollment, staffing, facilities, programs, and more.

MCPS staff has been working diligently to develop and improve a continuity of learning (distance/remote learning) plan that addresses the academic and non-academic needs of our students. Information about the second phase of learning was emailed to families on April 19 and can be found on the Online Learning website.

The mission of MCPS is to ensure every student has the academic, creative problem solving, and social emotional skills to be successful in college, career, and community, regardless of his or her background. Read more
The most up-to-date information from Montgomery County Public Schools concerning the Coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak is maintained on the linked website

a.h4: MCPS Videos for Students and Families

div.p: MCPS programming on cable and online with the latest news and video content to support our students, staff and community. Stream online and subscribe to the YouTube channel. Watch on cable at Comcast 34 (HD 998), Verizon 36 and RCN 89. Learn about programs from Eureka Math for K-5 students airing on cable channels.
Online support for students and families to help build proficiency in mathematics

KFIs assess major infrastructure elements in a variety of categories. KFIs are components of a facility that taken together provide an overall description of an individual school's facility condition.

The Safe Schools Maryland Tip Line is an anonymous reporting system used to report threats to the safety and/or well-being of students. Use this free and anonymous tool to let authorities know of any threat to schools or if a student is in crisis.

p.a: The Districtwide Boundary Analysis is an initiative designed to provide a comprehensive assessment of Montgomery County Public School boundaries by analyzing various data points.The most up-to-date information can be found on the linked website

div.p: Whether walking, riding your bike, driving or taking the bus; this website provides safety tips to ensure all of us get to school and get home safely.

dl.dd: Early release day for students (Innovative Schools Only)
